hi all - can someone point me to the reference guide for Linked Files, please?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Here you are!

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/configuration|Configuring Modules – Adding CSS and Javascript Dependencies>

Admittedly, it’s pretty limited documentation — I’m only aware of its uses for referencing external stylesheets and scripts. No clue what use the “other files” section is.
Thanks all. I was wondering if it was possible to use it for an image-selector. My hope was I can use it to choose between a choice of logos for a designer:
I was hoping then I could pull .height and .width properties from the linked files.

Ah — probably not. The ‘canonical’ solution for what you’re trying to do would just be to give them an image field, then create a “Logos” folder in HubFS for them to pick from.

If you’re looking to be a bit more restrictive, you could use a select field and hard-code the references.

However, the only part that seems to work is

  `<img  src="{{ module.choose_logo.choice_field }}" />`

where the choice field is the tag of each logo (e.g. "`{{ module_asset_url("logo-box-white-black-sq.png") }}`"

Yeah, the `module_asset_url` or `get_asset_url` functions only return an asset’s URL. To programmatically get width and height from an image, it needs to be in HubFS and needs to be retrieved via an image field.
